question: I should've known you would have been here Professor McGonagall.
answer: Good evening Professor Dumbledore. Are the rumors true Albus?

question: I'm afraid so Professor. The good and the bad.
answer: And the boy?

question: Hagrid is bringing him.
answer: Do you think it wise to trust Hagrid w/ something as important as this?

question: Ah, Prof. I would trust Hagrid w/ my life
answer: Professor. Dumbledore, sir. Professor McGonagall.

question: No problems I trust Hagrid?
answer: No, sir. Little tyke fell asleep as we were flying over Bristol. Try not to wake him. There you go.

question: Here he comes the birthday boy! Why don't you just cook the breakfast and try not to burn anything.
answer: Yes Aunt Petunia.

question: I want everything to be perfect for my Dudley's special day!
answer: yes Uncle Vernon.

question: How many are there?
answer: 36, Counted them myself.

question: 36?! BUT LAST YEAR LAST YEAR I HAD 37!!!
answer: Yes, but some of them are a bit bigger than last year's!

question: MOVE!
answer: He's asleep.

question: He's boring.
answer: Sorry about him he doesn't understand what it's like, lying there day after day watching people press their ugly faces in on you. Can you hear me? It's just I've never talked to a snake before. Do you... Do you talk to people often? You're from Burma, aren't you? Was it nice there? Did you miss your family? I see. That's me as well. I never knew my parents either.

question: Mummy, Dad, come here you won't believe what this snake is doing! Woah! Woah! Ah!
answer: Any time.

question: Right you are Harry. No post on Sunday. Ha! No blasted letters today! No, sir! Not one single bloody letter! Not one! No sir, not one blasted, miserable-
answer: Make it stop, please!

question: Stop it!
answer: Mummy what's happening?

question: I am.
answer: Well of course you are! Got something for you. Afraid I might have sat on it at some point but I imagine it'll taste fine just the same. Baked it myself, words and all.

question: Thank you!
answer: It's not everyday your young man turns 11 now it is?

question: Excuse me, but who are you?
answer: Rubeus Hagrid, Keeper of Keys and Grounds at Hogwarts. Of course you know all about Hogwarts

question: Sorry, no.
answer: No? Blimey Harry didn't you ever wonder didn't you ever wonder how your mum and dad learned it all?

question: Learned what?
answer: You're a wizard Harry.

question: I'm a what?
answer: A wizard. And a thumpin' good one I'd wager once you've trained up a bit.

question: No, you've made a mistake. I mean I can't be a wizard... I mean I'm Harry, Just Harry.
answer: Well, "Just Harry" did you ever make anything happen? Anything you couldn't explain, when you were angry or scared? Um Hum.

question: Yes, well must be going now. Lots to buy.
answer: Good bye.

question: See, Harry? You're famous.
answer: But why am I famous Hagrid? All those people back there how is it they know who I am?

question: But Hagrid how am I to pay for all this? I haven't any money.
answer: Well there's your money Harry! Gringotts, the wizard bank! Ain't no safer place, not one! 'Cept perhaps Hogwarts.

question: Hagrid what exactly are these things?
answer: They're goblins Harry. Clever as they come the goblins, but not the most friendly of beasts. Best stay close. Mr. Harry Potter wishes to make a withdrawal Wait a minute. Got it here somewhere. Ha! There's the little devil. Oh, and there's something else as well. Professor Dumbledore gave me this. It's about You- Know- What in vault you know which. Didn't think your mum and dad would leave you with nothing now did you?

question: What's in there Hagrid?
answer: Can't tell you Harry. Hogwarts business. Very secret. Best not to mention this to anyone Harry.

question: I still need... a wand.
answer: A wand? Well, you want Ollivander's. There ain't no place better. Why don't you run along and wait. I got one more thing to do. Won't be long.

question: Hello? Hello? Sorry but what's curious And who owned that wand?
answer: Harry! Harry! Happy Birthday!

question: Woah!
answer: You all right Harry? You seem very quiet.

question: He killed my parents didn't he? The one who gave me this. You know Hagrid. I know you do.
answer: First and understand this Harry because it's very important. Not all wizards are good. Some of them go bad. A few years ago one of them went as bad as you can go. His name was V--. His name was V--.

question: Well maybe if you wrote it down?
answer: Naw I can't spell it. All right, Voldemort.

question: Voldemort?
answer: Shh. It was dark times Harry, dark times. Voldemort started to gather some followers. Brought them over to the Dark Side. Anyone who stood up to him ended up dead. Your parents fought against him. Nobody lived once he decided to kill them. Nobody, not one. Except you.

question: Me? Voldemort tried to kill me?
answer: Yes. That ain't no ordinary cut on your forehead Harry. A mark from that only comes from being touched by a curse, an evil curse at that.

question: What happened to V--... To You-Know-Who?
answer: Well some say he died. Codswallop in my opinion. Nope, I reckon he's out there still too tired to carry on. But one thing's absolutely certain. Something about you stumped him that night. That's why you're famous. That's why everybody knows your name. You're the boy who lived. Well some say he died. Codswallop in my opinion. Nope, I reckon he's out there still too tired to carry on. But one thing's absolutely certain. Something about you stumped him that night. That's why you're famous. That's why everybody knows your name. You're the boy who lived. What are you looking at? Blimey is that time? Sorry Harry, but I'm gonna have to leave you. Dumbledore would be wanting his... Well, he'd be wanting to see me. Now, your train leaves in 10 minutes. Here's your ticket. Stick to it Harry, that's very important. Stick to you ticket.

question: Platform 9 ? But, Hagrid, there must be a mistake. This says Platform 9 . There's no such thing. Is there?
answer: Sorry.

question: Excuse me! Excuse me!
answer: On your left.

question: Excuse me sir. Can you tell me where I might find Platform 9 ?
answer: 9 ? Think you're being funny do you?

question: Muggles? Excuse me! Could you tell me how to...
answer: Excuse me, do you mind? Every where else is full.

question: Not at all.
answer: I'm Ron by the way! Ron Weasley.

question: I'm Harry. Harry Potter.
answer: SO it's true! DO you really have the... the...

question: The what?
answer: The scar?

question: Oh!
answer: Wicked!

question: No, thanks, I'm all set.
answer: We'll take the lot!

question: Woah!
answer: Bertie Bott's Every Flavor Beans?

question: They mean every flavor! There's chocolate, peppermint and also, spinach liver, and tripe. George sweared he got boogie flavored one once.
answer: These aren't real frogs are they?

question: It's just a spell. But it's the cards you want. Each pack's got a famous witch or wizard. I got about 500 me self. Watch it! That's rotten luck. They've only got one good jump in them to begin with.
answer: I've got Dumbledore!

question: I've got about 6 of him.
answer: Hey, he's gone!

question: Well you can't expect him to hang around all day, can you? This is Scabbers by the way. Pathetic isn't he?
answer: Just a little bit.

question: Fred gave me a spell to turn him yellow. Want to see?
answer: Yeah!

question: Ahem... Sunshine...
answer: has anyone seen a toad? A boy named Neville's has one.

question: No.
answer: Oh are you doing magic? Let's see then.

question: Ahem. Sunshine Daisies Butter Mellow Turn this stupid fat rat yellow.
answer: Are you sure that's a real spell? Well, it's not very good is it? Of course, I've only tried a few simple ones myself but they've all worked for me. For example

question: I'm Ron Weasley.
answer: Pleasure. You two better change into your robes. I expect we'll be arriving soon. You've dirt on your nose by the way. Just there.

question: ...where shall I put you? Let's see... I know! Hufflepuff!
answer: Ronald Weasley!

question: Ha! Another Weasley! I know just what to do with you... Gryffindor!
answer: Harry potter

question: Gryffindors, follow me, please. Keep up. Thank-you.
answer: Ravenclaw follow me. This way.

question: This is the most direct part to the dormitories. Oh, and keep an eye on the staircases, they like to change. Keep up please, and follow me. Quickly now, come on. Come on.
answer: That picture's moving! Look at that one. I think she fancies you. Look, look! Who's that girl?

question: There will be no foolish wand-waving or silly incantations in this class. As such, I don't expect many of you to appreciate the subtle science and exact art that is potion making. However, for those select few who possess the predisposition. I can teach you how to bewitch the mind and ensnare the senses. I show you how to bottle fame, brew glory, and even put a stopper in death. Then again maybe some of you have come to Hogwarts in possession of abilities so formidable that you feel confident enough to not pay attention. Mr. Potter, our new celebrity. Tell me what would I get if I added root of asphodel to an infusion of wormwood? You don't know? Well let's try again. Where Mr. Potter would you look if I asked you to find me a bezoar?
answer: I don't know, sir.

question: And what is the difference between monkswood and wolfsbane?
answer: I don't know sir.

question: Pity. Clearly fame isn't everything. Is it Mr. Potter?
answer: What's Seamus trying to do to that glass of water?

question: Harry Potter! Follow me. You wait here.
answer: ... this is an ingredient...

question: Professor Quirrell, excuse me, excuse me could I borrow Wood for a moment, please?
answer: Well, yes of course.

question: Quidditch is easy enough to understand. Each team has 7 players. Three Chasers, two Beaters, one Keeper and a Seeker, that's you. There are three kinds of balls. This one's called the Quaffle. The Chasers handle the Quaffle and try to put it through one of those three hoops. The Keeper, that's me, defends the hoops. With me so far?
answer: I think so. What are those?

question: You better take this. Careful now, it's coming back. Not bad Potter, you'd make a fair Beater. Uh-oh.
answer: What was that?

question: Bludgers. Nasty little buggers. But you are a Seeker. The only thing I want you to worry about is this, the Golden Snitch.
answer: I like this ball.

question: Eh, you like it now. But it's wicked fast and damn near impossible to see.
answer: What do I do with it?

question: You catch it. Before the other team's Seeker. You catch this the game's over. You catch this, Potter, and we win.
answer: Woah!

question: How could a troll get in?
answer: Not on its own. Trolls are really stupid. Probably people playing jokes. What?

question: Hermione! She doesn't know!
answer: I think the troll's left the dungeon!

question: Woah!
answer: Ugh!

question: Do something!
answer: What?

question: Oh my goodness! Explain yourselves both of you!
answer: It's my fault Professor Mc Gonagall

question: Miss. Granger?
answer: I went looking for the troll I've read about them and I though I could handle it. But I was wrong. If Harry and Ron hadnt come and found me... Id probably be dead.

question: That explains the blood.
answer: Blood?

question: Listen, last night, I'm guessing Snape let the troll in as diversion so he could get past that three headed dog. But, he got bit, that's why he's limping.
answer: But why would anyone go near that dog?

question: The day I was at Gringotts, Hagrid took something out of one of the vaults. Said it was Hogwarts business, very secret.
answer: So you're saying- -

question: That's what the dog's guarding. That's what Snape wants.
answer: A bit early for mail isn't it?

question: But, I never get mail.
answer: Let's open it.

question: It's a broomstick.
answer: It's not just a broomstick, Harry. It's a Nimbus 2000!

question: But who--?
answer: Scared, Harry?

question: A little.
answer: It's alright. I felt the same way before my first game.

question: What happened?
answer: I.. uh...I don't really remember... Took a Bludger to the head two minutes in. Woke in the hospital a week later.

question: It's Snape! He's jinxing the broom!
answer: Jinxing the broom?! What do we do?

question: Leave it to me!
answer: Come on Hermione!

question: Well, of course, he's got a name! He's mine! I brought him off an Irish feller I met down at the pub last year. Then I lent him to Dumbledore to guard the---
answer: Yes?

question: I shouldn't have said that. No more questions! Don't ask anymore question! That's top- secret that is.
answer: But Hagrid, whatever Fluffy's guarding Snape's trying to steal it!

question: Exactly.
answer: Now listen to me, all three of you, you're meddling in things that ought not to be meddled in. It's dangerous! What that dog is guarding is strictly between Professor Dumbledore and Nicholas Flamel.

question: Nicholas Flamel?
answer: I shouldn't have said that. I should not have said that.

question: Queen to E-5.
answer: That's totally barbaric!

question: That's wizard's chess. I see you've packed.
answer: See you haven't.

question: Change of plans. My parents have decided to go to Romania to visit my brother Charlie. He's studying dragons there.
answer: Good. You can help Harry then. He's going to look in the library for information on Nicholas Flamel.

question: We've looked a hundred times!
answer: Not in the Restricted Section. Happy Christmas.

question: I think we've had a bad influence on her. Harry wake up! Come on Harry! Wake up! Happy Christmas Harry!
answer: Happy Christmas Ron! What are you wearing?

question: Oh, my mum made it. Looks like you've got one too.
answer: I've got presents?

question: Yeah! There they are.
answer: "Your father left this in my possession before he died. It is time it was returned to you. Use it well."?

question: What is it?
answer: Some kind of cloak.

question: Well let's see then! Put it on! Woah!
answer: My body is gone!

question: I know what that is! That's an Invisibility Cloak!
answer: I'm invisible?

question: They're really rare. I wonder who gave it to you.
answer: There was no name. It just said, "Use it well." Famous Fire Eaters. Fifteenth Century Fiends. Flamel. Nicholas Flamel. Where are you?

question: Mum, Dad? Ron! You've really gotta see this! Ron! You've gotta see this! Ron! Come on, get out of bed!
answer: Why?

question: There's something you've got to see! Now, come on! Come on! Come! Come look! It's my parents!
answer: I only see us.

question: Look in properly. Go on, stand there. There. You see them don't you? That's---
answer: That's me! Only, I'm Head Boy. And I'm holding the Quidditch Cup. And bloody hell! I'm Quidditch captain too! I look good! Harry, do you think this mirror shows the future?

question: I had you looking in the wrong section! How could I be so stupid? I checked this out weeks ago for a bit of light reading!
answer: This is light?

question: Of course! Here it is! "Nicholas Flamel is the only known maker of the Sorcerer's Stone Honestly don't you two read? "The Sorcerer's Stone is a legendary substance with astonishing powers. It will transform any metal into pure gold and produce the Elixir of Life which will make the drinker immortal."
answer: Immortal!

question: It means you'll never die.
answer: I know what it means!

question: Hagrid!
answer: Oh, hello. I don't wish to be rude, but I'm in no fit state to entertain today.

question: We think Snape's trying to steal it.
answer: Snape? Blimey, you're still on about him, are you?

question: Hagrid! We know he's after the Stone we just don't know why!
answer: Snape is one of the teachers protecting the Stone! He's not about to steal it.

question: What?
answer: You heard. Right, now, come on, I'm a bit preoccupied today.

question: Isn't he beautiful? Oh bless him look, he knows his mummy! Hello Norbert!
answer: Norbert?

question: Well he's gotta have a name don't he? Don't you Norbert? Te de de de de! Oh! Woah! He'll have to be trained up a bit of course. Who's that?
answer: Malfoy.

question: Oh, dear.
answer: Hagrid always wanted a dragon. He told me so the first time I ever met him.

question: Wait till my father hears about this! This is servant stuff.
answer: If I didn't know better Draco, I'd say you were scared.

question: Scared Potter. Did you hear that?
answer: Come on Fang!

question: Scared!
answer: What is it Fang?

question: Harry Potter, you must leave. You are known to many creatures here. The Forest is not safe at this time. Especially for you.
answer: But what was that thing you saved me from?

question: A monstrous creature. It is a terrible crime to slay a unicorn. Drinking the blood of a unicorn will keep you alive even if you are an inch from death. But at a terrible price. For you have slain something so pure that the moment the blood touches your lips you have a half-life, a cursed life.
answer: But who would choose such a life?

question: Can you think of no one?
answer: You mean to say that thing that killed the unicorn, that was drinking its blood, that was Voldemort?

question: Do you know what is hidden in the school at this very moment, Mr. Potter?
answer: The Sorcerer's Stone!

question: Don't you think it's a bit odd that what Hagrid want more than anything is a dragon and a stranger turns up and just happens to have one? I mean, how many people wander around with dragon eggs in their pockets? Why didn't I see it before? Hagrid, who gave you that dragon egg? What did he look like?
answer: I dunno. I never saw his face. He kept his hood up.

question: This stranger though, you and he must have talked.
answer: Well, he wanted to know what sort of creatures I looked after. And I told him, after Fluffy a dragon's gonna be no problem.

question: Did he seem interested in Fluffy?
answer: Well of course he was interested in Fluffy! How often do you come across three headed dogs do you come across even if you're in the trade? But I told him, I said, I said, "The trick with any beast is to know how to calm him." Take Fluffy for example, just play him a bit of music and he falls straight asleep. I shouldn't have told you that. Where are you going? Where are you---?

question: We have to see professor Dumbledore immediately! We have to see Professor Dumbledore immediately!
answer: Im afraid Professor Dumbledores not here. He received an urgent owl from the Ministry of Magic and left immediately for London.

question: Hes gone! But this is important! This is about the Sorcerers Stone!
answer: How did you know ---?

question: Someones going to try to steal it!
answer: I dont know how you three found out about the Stone but I assure you it is perfectly well protected. Now would you go back to your dormitories quietly.

question: And with Dumbledore gone---
answer: Good afternoon. Now, what would three young Gryffindors, such as yourselves be doing inside on a day like this?

question: We were... we were just---
answer: Youd ought to be careful. People willht think youre up to something.

question: Wait a minute. Hes snoring. Snapes already been here. Hes put a spell on the harp.
answer: Ugh! Its got horrible breath.

question: We have to move its paw.
answer: What?

question: Are you okay?
answer: Yeah, yeah Im fine.

question: Hes not relaxing is he?
answer: Apparently not.

question: Weve got to do something!
answer: What?

question: I remember reading something in Herbology. Devils Snare Devils Snare its deadly fun; but will sulk in the sun. Thats it! Devils Snare hates sunlight! Lumus Solem!
answer: Ron, are you okay?

question: What is that?
answer: I dont know Sounds like wings.

question: Curious, Ive never seen birds like these.
answer: Theyre not birds theyre keys. And Ill bet one of then fits that door.

question: Whats this all about?
answer: I dont know. Strange.

question: Now what do we do?
answer: Its obvious isnt it? Weve got to play our way across the room. All right, Harry, you take the empty bishops square. Hermione youll be the queen-side castle. As for me, Ill be a knight.

question: What happens now?
answer: Well, white moves first, and then we play.

question: Ron you dont suppose thisll be like real wizards chess do you?
answer: You there D-5. Yes Hermione I think this is gonna be exactly like wizards chess. Castle to E-4! Pawn to C-3!

question: Ron! No dont move! Dont forget were still playing! Checkmate! Take care of Ron then go to the owlery. Send a message to Dumbledore. Rons right. I have to go on.
answer: Youll be okay Harry. Youre a great wizard. You really are.

question: Not as good as you.
answer: Me? Books, cleverness. There are more important things. Friendship and bravery. And Harry, just be careful.

question: You? No it cant be; Snape he was he was the one---
answer: Yes he does seem the type doesnt he? Next to him who would suspect p-p-poor st-st-stuttering Professor Quirrell?

question: But that day, during the Quidditch match, Snape tried to kill me.
answer: Oh no dear boy, I tried to kill you! And trust me if Snapes cloak hadnt caught on fire and broken my eye contact I would have succeeded. Even with Snape muttering his little counter-curse.

question: Snape was trying to save me?
answer: I knew you were a danger to me right from the off. Especially after Halloween.

question: Then then you let the troll in!
answer: Very good Potter yes. Snape unfortunately wasnt fooled, when every one else was running about the dungeon Snape went to the third floor to head me of. He of course never trusted me again. He rarely left me alone. But he doesnt understand, Im never alone. Never. Now does this mirror do? I see what I desire. I see myself holding the Stone. But how do I get it?

question: He lies.
answer: Tell the truth! What do you see?

question: Let me speak to him.
answer: Master you are not strong enough.

question: have strength enough for this. Harry Potter, we meet again.
answer: Voldemort?

question: Yes, you see what I have become? See what I must do to survive? Live off another. A mere parasite. Unicorn blood can sustain me but it cannot give me a body of my own. But there is something that can. Something that conveniently enough lies in your pocket. Stop him! Dont be a fool! Why suffer a horrific death when you can join with me and live?
answer: Never!

question: Bravery, your parents had it too. Tell me Harry would you like to see your mother and father again? Together we can bring them back. All I ask is for something in return. Thats it Harry. There is no good and evil, there is only power and those too weak to seek it. Together we'll do extraordinary things. Just give me the Stone!
answer: You liar!

question: Good afternoon Harry. Tokens from your admirers.
answer: Admirers?

question: What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret. So naturally the whole school knows. Ah, I see that your friend Ronald has saved you the trouble of opening your Chocolate Frogs.
answer: Ron was here? Is he alright? What about Hermione?

question: Fine. They're both just fine.
answer: Bu, what happened to the Stone?

question: Relax dear boy. The Stone has been destroyed. My friend Nicholas and I have had a little chat and agreed it was best all around.
answer: But then Flamel, he'll die won't he?

question: He has enough Elixir of Life to set his affairs in order. But yes, he will die.
answer: How is it I got the Stone sir? One minute I was there staring in the mirror and then the next---

question: Ah, you see only a person who wanted to find the Stone, find it, but not use it would be able to get it. That is one of my more brilliant ideas. And between you and me that is saying something.
answer: Does that mean with the Stone gone that is, that Voldemort can never come back?

question: Ah, I'm afraid there are ways in which he can return. Harry do you know why Professor Quirrell couldn't bear to have you touch him? It was because of your mother. She sacrificed herself for you. And that kind of act leaves a mark. No, no this kind of mark cannot be seen. It lives in your very skin.
answer: What is it?

question: Love Harry. Love. Bertie Bott's Every Flavor Beans. I was most unfortunate in my youth to come across a vomit flavor one. Since then I'm afraid I've lost my liking for them. But I think I could be safe with a nice toffee. Alas! Earwax!
answer: Alright there Ron?

question: One minute.
answer: Thought you were leaving without saying good-bye did you? This is for you.

question: Thanks Hagrid.
answer: Oh. Go on. On with you. On with you now. On with you. Oh, listen, Harry. If that dolt of a cousin of yours Dudley gives you any grief you can always um... threaten him, with a nice pair of ears to go with that tail of his.

question: But Hagrid, we're not allowed to do magic away from Hogwarts. You know that.
answer: I know that. But your cousin don't do he?
